title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Friday 23 March - BBC News
summary: lorry drivers jailed for m1 crash which left eight people dead .
police officer in court over dangerous driving charge .
man questioned on sus of terrorism .
derby north mp breaches code of conduct .
calls for memorial at leicester explosion scene .
boris johnson brands derby assembly rooms plan 'crackpot ' .
profits fall for leicester retailer next .

documents.title: leicester 16-15 wasps
text: leicester 16-15 wasps

documents.title: our coverage for the day
text: our live coverage for the week has now ended , east midlands live returns from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: body of man found in chesterfield park
text: a man 's body has been found in the grounds of somersall park in chesterfield .
derbyshire police said it believes it 's the body of andrew dyas , who was reported missing from his home in inkersall on wednesday , but formal identification has yet to take place .

documents.title: a50 east reopens after earlier crash
text: good news for drivers in derbyshire - the a50 eastbound has reopened after a crash closed the carriageway earlier .
highways england said the car has been recovered from near the junction with the a6 into derby but there are several miles of queuing traffic which could take a while to clear .
the red coloured roads give an indication of just how congested it is .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: lorry drivers jailed over fatal m1 crash
text: lorry drivers jailed over fatal m1 crash

documents.title: trams held after crash in nottingham
text: a crash on university boulevard has led to all trams being held .
here 's the latest from tramlink nottingham .
delays : due to a road traffic collision at university boulevard all trams have been held until we have further information .
updates will follow as soon as we have them .
apologies for any inconvenience caused .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News

documents.title: six miles of queues after a50 crash
text: there 's not going to be a quick getaway this friday for motorists along the a50 .
an eastbound crash near chellaston has caused an eye-watering six miles of queues .
# derbyshire on the # a50 eastbound near # chellaston , approaching the junction with the # a6 ( junction 2 ) , @ twitterid are recovering vehicles involved in an collision .
approx ' 6 mile of queuing traffic , back towards the # a38 .
allow plenty of extra time for your journey .
author: Highways England

documents.title: documentary hospital filmed in nottingham
text: two 's documentary hospital returns on monday .
it was filmed at nottingham 's queen 's medical centre during the worst winter for the nhs on record .
will you be watching ?
author: BBC One

documents.title: egyptian and italian officials discuss student death
text: officials from egypt and italy have met with a representative of the family of mariam moustafa , the nottingham student who died three weeks after being attacked .
an inquest into her death proved inconclusive , and questions have been asked in egypt about the police investigation .
nottingham east mp chris leslie hosted the meeting , which he said was `` useful '' to discuss what happens next .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: lorry drivers jailed over fatal m1 crash
text: two lorry drivers have been jailed over a crash on the m1 in buckinghamshire that killed eight people last year .
the victims were travelling in a minibus , which was carrying 11 indian tourists from nottingham to london ahead of a trip to disneyland paris .
ryszard masierak , 31 , was jailed for 14 years after being found guilty of causing death by dangerous driving .
david wagstaff , 54 , was sentenced to 40 months in prison after pleading guilty to causing death by careless driving .
author: BBC News

documents.title: east midlands restaurants to close under prezzo plans
text: leicester and nottingham branches of prezzo are due to close as the restaurant chain announced plans to close 94 of its outlets .
the derby branch of mexico is also set to shut as part of the plans .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: 'reckless ' bikers pull wheelies on m1
text: 'reckless ' bikers pull wheelies on m1

documents.title: one change for nottingham against ealing
text: ian costello has made one change as he prepares his nottingham side to take on ealing trailfinders this weekend .
joe cobden ( comes in at centre for the green and whites , with gearoid lyons dropping to the bench .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: appeal for witnesses over swadlincote hit-and-run
text: derbyshire police are looking for the driver of a black audi after a man was hit by a car in swadlincote .
the victim , who is in his 50s , was carried on the bonnet of the car after being hit on north street at about 16:20 on 4 march .
a force spokesman said the pedestrian was not seriously injured , but they 're appealing for any witnesses to come forward to help them trace the driver .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News

documents.title: further charges in derby modern slavery probe
text: an eleventh person has been charged as part of a wide-ranging modern slavery investigation across latvia and derby .
the man , 25 , was extradited from latvia on wednesday and appeared in court on thursday charged with conspiracy offences linked to slavery , trafficking and exploitation .
he was remanded into custody to appear before derby crown court next month .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: breakingpolice officer in court over dangerous driving charge
text: a nottinghamshire police officer will appear in court next week to face a charge of dangerous driving .
pc neil copland is accused of dangerous driving in relation to an incident in derby road , nottingham , on 4 december 2016 .
an investigation has already been carried out by the independent office for police conduct following a crash involving an unmarked police car and a pedestrian .
the 48-year-old will appear at leicester magistrates ' court on 27 march .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News

documents.title: leicester man wanted by police after missing court
text: police have issued an arrest warrant for a man from leicester after he failed to turn up for a sentencing hearing in court .
sussex police said aaron michael rhys wilson pleaded guilty last year to six child sex offences relating to incidents that took place at a property in st leonards-on-sea in 2015 .
the 23-year-old failed to turn up to a pre-sentencing hearing in december , as well as his sentencing at lewes crown court in january , leading to the issuing of a warrant .
det con joanna cooper said wilson also has links to derby , and appealed to the public for help in tracing him .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News

documents.title: watch : 'reckless ' motorcyclists pull wheelies on m1
text: here 's the shocking moment two motorcyclists were caught on a major motorway pulling wheelies .
the pair were caught on a car dashcam driving erratically near trowell services in nottinghamshire on the southbound carriageway of the m1 on 11 march .
nottinghamshire police confirmed they received a report of motorbikes being driven dangerously .
a spokeswoman said they referred it to neighbouring forces but did not know if any arrests had been made .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: ex-royal footman lands police job
text: a former aide to the queen and the duke of york has swapped his career with the royals to become a police officer in derbyshire .
pc john revill , who will be working in ilkeston , also had a spell as a special constable for thames valley police .
he said : `` i first worked for the queen at buckingham palace as a footman .
i was then promoted to senior footman and for my final year i was a page of the presence .
`` from 1998 until joining derbyshire constabulary , i worked personally for the duke of york as his valet .
`` this meant looking after his wardrobe as well as other duties around his private home , royal lodge , including butlering and driving for princesses beatrice and eugenie . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: rise in number of gritting trips for council
text: gritting lorries have spread almost 20,000 tonnes of salt on leicestershire 's roads since the start of november , according to the county council .
the authority said its vehicles had also completed 1,443 night gritting runs , a 57 % increase on the total number of runs for the same period last year .
councillor blake pain said : `` as a county we grit 45 % of leicestershire 's roads and i have passed on my thanks to our gritting team for the work they 've done . ''
author: Amy Orton
Local Democracy Reporter

documents.title: broken down train causing delays
text: east midlands trains tweets
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: hospital boss apologises over delayed operations
text: a senior hospital boss has apologised to the patients who 've been inconvenienced by the postponement of some planned surgery at nottingham 's queen 's medical centre and city hospital until at least next thursday .
about 90 operations will now not go ahead .
miriam duffy , operations director at nottingham university hospitals trust , says the decision has been made to help them cope with increased demand on resources .
author: Lewis Scrimshaw
News editor, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: mansfield and notts county hoping for promotion push
text: after their derby match ended in a 1-1 draw last week , both mansfield town and notts county will be aiming for a win this weekend to keep their hopes of automatic promotion alive .

the magpies , who are just three points off third-placed wycombe , play at second-bottom chesterfield on sunday , while the stags - who scored a late penalty to take a point at meadow lane - are away to forest green rovers on saturday .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: fire at market harborough electrical substation
text: firefighters have been tackling a blaze at an electrical substation in market harborough this morning .
leicestershire fire and rescue service said it had several calls reporting a fire at marshall court off northampton road .
crews from market harborough and wigston are currently on the scene , and residents are being advised to keep their windows closed to avoid smoke getting into their homes .
western power has also confirmed the electrical substation has been isolated , but supplies in the area will be disrupted most of the day .
update : we 've got most supplies back on in the # marketharborough area , but are working to restore the remaining properties by approximately 18:00 .
andi .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News

documents.title: absconded prisoner returned to jail
text: a prisoner who absconded from jail earlier this week has been caught by police .
adrian mcneish , who was given a nine-year sentence in 2015 for possession of a firearm with intent to endanger life , went missing from hmp sudbury on wednesday .
derbyshire police confirmed today he has been re-arrested and returned to prison .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News

documents.title: england internationals return for tigers
text: england internationals dan cole , jonny may and george ford come straight into the leicester tigers starting 15 for sunday 's premiership clash with wasps .
prop ellis genge is fit enough to join the replacements , but injuries to back-rowers mike williams and brendon o'connor rule them out .

documents.title: basketball : riders finally complete tawiah signing
text: leicester riders have completed the signing of 6ft 10in forward chris tawiah from czech republic side bk lions .
the brit had already put pen to paper on a deal to keep him at the club until the end of the season , but the move stalled for nearly two weeks due to a paperwork issue .

tawiah , 24 , has been brought in as cover behind andy thomson and shane walker who have both travelled with england to the commonwealth games.he could make his riders debut tonight at glasgow rocks in the bbl championship .
author: Owynn Palmer-Atkin
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: england defender 'might have gone into finance '
text: leicester city defender harry maguire could have gone into accounting or finance if football had not worked out .
maguire , 25 , could win his fourth england cap this evening when gareth southgate 's side take on the netherlands but up an a in maths at gcse .
sue cain , deputy headteacher at st mary 's catholic high school in chesterfield , says maguire was a model pupil .
you can hear more about the rise of harry maguire on the leicester city boot room podcast .
author: Mike McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: a46 reopens after vehicle fire
text: some good news to start the afternoon off .
recovery completed and all lanes re-opened on the # a46 southbound between # a617 and b6166 # farndon following a vehicle fire .
thanks for your patience

documents.title: swimmer drops out of commonwealth games squad
text: nottinghamshire paralympic swimmer ollie hynd has pulled out of england 's commonwealth games squad , just days before the event is due to start .
he 's the defending champion , but was unhappy after being reclassified to compete against less-impaired swimmers .

he said the reclassification from the s8 category to s9 `` has come as a huge shock to me '' , but wished the england team luck as they prepare for the games , which take place in gold coast next month .
this very difficult news has taken an unbelievable toll on my training and mindset for the commonwealth games .
with this in mind , i have reluctantly withdrawn from the competition and will not fly out to australia . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: broken down train causing delays across nottinghamshire
text: a fault in a train is causing delays to services between mansfield , nottingham and worksop , east midlands trains has confirmed .
the line is currently closed as no trains are able to run between the stations .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News

documents.title: councillor resigns from conservatives
text: a conservative councillor has resigned from the party and become an independent after what she called `` irregularities '' in the candidate selection process for councillors .
sarah hewson , who represents the plains ward on gedling borough council , left the party and decided to serve as an independent councillor over the way she says the selection process was run .
a conservative party official has been drafted in to ensure rules are adhered to at the gedling association .

a spokesman for gedling conservatives said they were `` disappointed '' that the councillor had left , but that they are still on the lookout for `` enthusiastic and hardworking candidates across the borough for next year 's local elections '' .
author: Kit Sandeman
Local Democracy Reporter

documents.title: tributes paid to 'bright and talented ' student
text: tributes have been paid to a 20-year-old leeds student who died after being hit by a private hire vehicle in the city last weekend .
alice walton , from newark in nottinghamshire , died on monday after being hit by the car on woodhouse street at about 04:30 on saturday morning .
she was a student of theatre and performance at leeds university .
professor alice o'grady said : `` we have all been deeply affected by the loss of such a bright and talented young woman .
`` alice 's tutors describe her as a brilliant student - creative and bold in her approach to her subject and full of compassion when working with others .
`` her friends tell me she was loved by everyone who knew her . ''

documents.title: man , 22 , injured after street assault
text: a 22-year-old man suffered a `` significant '' injury after a street assault in worksop .
nottinghamshire police said a man approached the victim in a car before getting out of the vehicle on newcastle avenue at about 13:45 on wednesday and attacking him .
the victim was taken to doncaster royal infirmary for treatment , and officers are appealing for witnesses to come forward .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News

documents.title: leicester duo ready for dutch test
text: harry maguire and jamie vardy will be hoping to line up for their country tonight as england take on the netherlands in an international friendly in amsterdam .
both will hope to impress in a bid to boost their chances of making gareth southgate 's world cup squad .
england will also play a warm-up match on tuesday against italy , who , like the dutch , surprisingly failed to qualify for this summer 's tournament in russia .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather watchers : boating about the east midlands
text: it 's grey and overcast across much of the region today , but there are splashes of sun and colour about , as this great shot from ilkeston by bry shows .
over in kegworth , scrappy 's cut through the cloud cover with a of very spring-like daffodils , while in misterton it almost looks like buster9 's been visiting the seaside .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: two continue to be held on sus of terrorism offences
text: two men continue to be questioned on sus of terrorism offences .
the 21-year-olds , from birmingham and leicester , were arrested from their home addresses on sus of preparing for terrorist acts , west midlands police said .
they remain in custody at a police station in the west midlands .
the arrests were intelligence-led , police said , and there is no immediate threat to the public .

documents.title: derby north mp breaches code of conduct
text: derby north mp chris williamson has been found in breach of the code of conduct for mps after he failed to register a second home that he owned .
the mail on sunday found the labour mp partly owns a second home in derby in january , but had n't declared it in the register of mp 's financial interests .
conservative north west leicestershire mp andrew bridgen made a complaint to the parliamentary commissioner for standards , which has now been upheld .
the commissioner said the property should have been registered sooner , and will now be highlighted in the register for 12 months .
mr williamson has apologised but says he was misled by the way the rules are written .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: woman 'had crush ' on rape-accused skater
text: woman 'had crush ' on rape-accused skater

documents.title: pictures from scene of vehicle fire on a46
text: this is the fire that has shut the a46 at farndon near newark on trent .
whilst en route to @ twitterid hq for regional chief and pcc meeting , i 've come across this at farndon a46 as first vehicle on scene .
fantastic response from @ twitterid & @ twitterid - all occupants safe .
road closed southbound for approximately 30 mins .
hope your hi vis was n't too blinding for oncoming motorists ( tagging @ twitterid for no reason at all : - ) )
actually , i had to borrow the chief 's in the boot and as you would expect of our chief , it 's well used .
hello shaun - please can we use these photos on the bbc website and social media pages ?
still a constable , even as acc .
seems to be a lot of cars bursting into flames recently

documents.title: vehicle fire closes a46
text: this might cause you some delays if you 're in the farndon area .
the # a46 is closed southbound between # a617 and b6166 # farndon due to a fire involving a vehicle carrying food .
@ twitterid and @ twitterid are at scene .
updates to follow
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: anti-social behaviour worries at chesterfield library
text: concerns have been raised over the behaviour of groups of young people near chesterfield 's library , derbyshire police has said .
a 15-year-old girl spat at one security officer , and other youths are said to have been `` acting anti-socially , being abusive and volatile '' in recent weeks .

pcso adele chapman-jones , from the chesterfield town centre safer neighbourhood policing team , said it 's stepping up patrols in the area , and asked for help from parents to make sure their children `` understand what is anti-social and unacceptable behaviour '' .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News

documents.title: ice dancer rape accusation 'awful thing '
text: ice dancer rape accusation 'awful thing '

documents.title: electric taxi arrives in nottingham
text: nottingham has become home to the first electric taxi outside of london .
we 're here nottingham !
the first electric taxi outside of london .
give us a follow or ( or even a hail !
always on the meter set by @ twitterid via @ twitterid or call for private bookings .
nice !
how much do they cost ?
£ 70,000 no joke
how much would a new diesel black cab cost to buy and what would it cost to run in a ty year ?
we 'd obviously recommend an ev but a diesel would need to be a euro 6 such as the mercedes vito .
costs are directly linked to mileage .
ok what 's the cost per mile .
50 mpg diesel is around 11p a mile in just fuel costs .
around 1.5p per mile in ev mode .
the company that makes the ev cab could do with a info graphic like this one for an electric bus .
hello - can we use this photo on the bbc website and social media pages please ?
yes , please do .
if you could credit @ twitterid
of course - thank you
to expensive , always use @ twitterid never # uber
not now they all use mytaxi app .
same if not cheaper than uber and d & g plus you get leg room they come to you just as the other taxi firms now
do n't use them , there a rip off .
nearly as bad as peeps who charge for sitting on a peice of fabric with a wooden frame in a city square to look at some sand
great to see , especially in nottingham .
i 'll be on the lookout : )
good luck with the new car !
all those people who scorn at those actually buying these vehicles with their own money and having the audacity to charge paying passengers 'would you like to lend him £ 63k and earn nothing ' .
'memyselfandi ' i guess !
will these be breaking down as often as the tram ?
from what i 've seen so .
the only thing you need following is a tow truck .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: crash causing delays in derby
text: the air ambulance has been called to the scene of a crash on the a5111 raynesway northbound in derby .
three cars and a lorry were involved in the collision .
traffic is queuing in the area with one of two lanes closed .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: inquest concludes sex offender killed himself
text: news has more on the inquest which concluded that it was `` unsuitable '' to stop monitoring the mental health of child sex offender ricky slade .
mr slade was found hanged in his cell at hmp nottingham on 3 february , 2017 , days before his sentencing .
he had been confronted by self-styled `` paedophile hunters '' the hunted one who filmed the encounter and released the footage before he was convicted .
the 30-year-old had chatted to members of the group who were posing as under-age girls .
slade , 29 at the time , arranged to meet who he thought was a 10-year-old girl .
the inquest jury in nottingham returned a conclusion of suicide .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News

documents.title: toft wins gold in para-cycling world championships
text: katie toft has won gold on the opening day at the para-cycling track world championships in brazil .
the derbyshire cyclist , who has cerebral palsy , took the medal for the the women 's c1 individual pursuit .
what a superb ride from @ twitterid who defeats china 's jieli li to claim gold in the women 's c1 individual pursuit !
that 's a second gold medal of the day for @ twitterid # paracycling2018
yessssss @ twitterid
well done @ twitterid more stripes and even bigger smiles heading back to @ twitterid
so well deserved .
well done katie
@ twitterid @ twitterid we should call you the amazing katie .
so pleased for you xx
the says it all !
congratulations @ twitterid x
congratulations @ twitterid on a golden day on the track # cpcan
congratulations katie
@ twitterid you have been on an amazing journey .
congratulations .
well done @ twitterid told you , you could do it , enjoy
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: step closer to new swimming complex
text: demolition of derby 's old moorways swimming pool is now complete after it closed to the public three years ago .
construction of a new swimming pool complex will start next year and is expected to look something like this
inside the new £ 33m building will be a 50m swimming pool , sauna , steam room , gym , exercise studios , soft play and multi-use rooms .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: teenager missing in bestwood
text: police are appealing for help to find a missing 14-year-old girl .
natalia szalach was reported missing from the bestwood area of nottingham at around 17:00 on wednesday .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: leicester explosion : calls for memorial
text: there are calls for a memorial to be built in memory of the five people killed when a shop exploded in leicester .
a committee was established to support those affected by the blast at the polish supermarket in hinckley road last month .
it said it would like to see a lasting memorial .

leicester city councillor ted cassidy said : `` we have set up a community recovery committee to make sure we are doing everything we can to help the community get over the situation and move forward and remember what 's happened in a positive way . ''
store owner aram kurd , 33 , hawkar hassan , 32 , and arkan ali , 37 , have been charged with arson and manslaughter .
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: boris slams 'crackpot ' plan for assembly rooms
text: boris johnson has said a 6 % rise in council tax in derby has nothing to do with the government .
speaking to the bbc on a campaign visit to the city yesterday the foreign secretary accused labour-run derby city council of being `` wasteful '' with taxpayers money .

it 's down to the wasteful mismanagement of the labour-controlled council who 've got crackpot plans like their £ 44m rebuilding of the assembly rooms , which i think the conservatives are rightly opposing .
that will save council tax payers a lot of money . ''
the city council said the government has shifted the burden for funding the assembly rooms onto local taxpayers and businesses .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: 'challenging ' year for next
text: annual profits at next fell by 8.1 % in what the high street retail chain described as a `` challenging '' year .
the leicester-based company said pre-tax profits dropped to £ 726.1m in the 12 months to january , marking the third year in a row that income has declined .
next said that sales of full-priced products at its stores tumbled in contrast to online demand .
it blamed `` a weak clothing market '' as well as `` self-inflicted product ranging errors and omissions '' .
author: BBC News

documents.title: foxes players travel to netherlands
text: leicester city 's jamie vardy and harry maguire could both be in action for england tonight .
the national side is taking on the netherlands in an international friendly .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: museum displays miners union banner
text: a union of democratic mineworkers banner has found a new home at bilsthorpe heritage museum .
it 's being displayed alongside its national union of miners counterpart following a long campaign by former miners .

children who are being brought up today have very little knowledge of the mining history and it 's good to have all the things in one place so they can see the history of the colliery in one place . ''
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: man questioned on sus of terrorism
text: a man from leicester has been arrested on sus of preparing for terrorist acts .
the 21-year-old was arrested at his home yesterday by west midlands police .
he is being questioned by counter terrorism officers along with another man arrested for the same offence in birmingham .
a spokesman from the police force said the arrests were intelligence-led and there was no immediate threat to the public .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather forecast
text: a mild day ahead but blustery at times with occasional outbreaks of rain .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live updates
text: good morning .
i 'll be bringing you today 's latest news , sport , travel and weather updates for the east midlands .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News
